name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: That's why I helped reintroduce the Keep Americans Safe Act to ban high-capacity magazines, which would go a long way in reducing the lethality of mass shootings like the one in Highland Park and saving precious lives.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: High-capacity magazines are designed to kill en masse–allowing a shooter to fire off dozens of bullets without having to reload. These weapons of war are all too often used in mass shootings across the country and are responsible for the deaths of countless innocent people.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Putin’s ambitions know no bounds. America, NATO, and our allies must be resolute in defense of democracy.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Our grievance is not with the Russian people, and it is unfortunate that they will be the ones to bear the greatest burden of the international response. Putin bears responsibility for their suffering every bit as much as he is responsible for the tragedy unfolding in Ukraine.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Additional sanctions must directly target Vladimir Putin, Russian elites, the Russian military and the country’s financial institutions.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: We see Vladimir Putin for what he is: a warmongering, dictatorial tyrant who seeks a permanent conflict with the West and restoration of Russian rule over the former Soviet empire.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: We will continue to assist Ukraine and the Ukrainian people with the resources necessary to defend their country and humanitarian assistance to feed and provide for their citizens.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: It is imperative for the US to resolutely lead with our allies in preserving the united response to Putin’s war.  We must stand together to support the people of Ukraine and also work in unison to mitigate the impact Putin’s illegal aggression will have on the global economy.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Putin is counting on the unity of the international community to fracture and wane in short order.  We must ensure that his confidence is misplaced and that his intentions are thwarted.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Vladimir Putin’s war against Ukraine is not just an unprovoked, illegal invasion of a sovereign country, but a blatant attack on the world order—an affront to every nation that respects international law and national self-determination.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: America and the world stand with the People of Ukraine.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Congress must ensure the U.S., with NATO and our European partners, is fully equipped to counter Putin and Russia’s warmongering and revanchist ambitions.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: It is critically important for Congress to demonstrate, with broad bipartisan support, the U.S. commitment to international law and security, and the independence of the people of Ukraine.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: I commend President Biden’s strong and swift response, uniting our NATO allies in combatting the belligerent Russian threat, and I stand ready in Congress to support and bolster these actions to hold Putin accountable.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Putin’s illegal escalation poses the greatest security threat to Europe and the world in decades.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Putin’s theater of lies is fooling no one — sending Russian troops into eastern Ukraine is the beginning of an invasion and a blatant violation of both international law and Ukraine’s sovereignty. The world must respond appropriately.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Putin’s moves in Ukraine are an affront to the democratic will of the Ukrainian people to determine their own future, and a flagrant and dangerous challenge to international law and security.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: The security of the United States is inextricably tied to upholding the universal commitment to international law, sovereign borders, and every nation's right to self-governance. 🧵

name: Rep. Brad Schneider

name: Rep. Brad Schneider

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Two things Congress can do immediately: (1) help Jewish institutions afford security enhancements, and (2) move forward on the appointment of Deborah Lipstadt as US Envoy to Combat and Monitor Antisemitism.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: The American white nationalist who murdered 11 worshipers at the Tree of Life Synagogue and the British national who held 4 worshipers captive at Congregation Beth Israel shared nothing in common—nothing but their choice to attack and terrorize Jews.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: The answers to all these questions are rooted in the simple reality of antisemitism.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Why do so many question the legitimacy of a Jewish state in the birthplace of the Jewish faith and the homeland of the Jewish people?

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Why do synagogues across the US, and around the world, require extra security, every single day?  Why are Jews warned when traveling to hide any public displays of their faith?

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Perhaps the question is not so much why did this one attacker chose a synagogue but why, irrespective of grievance, attacks disproportionately target synagogues and Jews?

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: The Beth Israel hostage taker flew from Britain and specifically selected a synagogue and held captive four Jews who were there for Shabbat prayer services.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: While relieved that the synagogue attack in Texas ended with the safe rescue of the hostages, we must remain steadfastly vigilant in the fight against antisemitism here and around the world. 🧵

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text:

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: We didn't let the insurrection and seizure of the Capitol stop us from doing what we needed to do. The most important message in Jan. 6 was that the Constitution held, that the elected representatives completed their task that day. https://t.co/8kEtb9qq7N

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: The fact that so much remains unknown about those responsible for the day’s carnage only underscores the importance of the work of the Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: The deaths of Kevin Greeson, Benjamin Phillips, Rosanne Boyland, and Ashli Babbitt were all tragic, and wholly avoidable.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Responsibility for the blood shed and lives lost on January 6th lies firmly in the hands of the rally’s organizers.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Their absence is keenly felt by their family and friends; their memories will forever be a blessing for our nation.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: more than 140 officers were injured, Officer Brian Sicknick died following the violence, and Officers Howard Liebengood, Jeffrey Smith, Kyle DeFreytag, and Gunther Hashida were all lost to suicide. Each of them bravely defended the Capitol.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Let us also always remember that our survival last January 6th did not come without costs. The U.S. Capitol Police and D.C. Metro Police suffered a terrible burden in defending the Capitol:

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: To secure faith in our elections, I urge the Senate to pass the Freedom to Vote Act. To combat rising extremism, I urge my colleagues to pass the bipartisan Domestic Terrorism Prevention Act introduced last year with my Senate colleague Dick Durbin.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: If we want to continue pursuing the American experiment, fundamentally, every American today should be working to ensure that every ballot can be cast safely, that it will be counted fairly, and that the outcome of our elections will reflect the true will of the people.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: There are no guarantees that our nation will persist as the kind of representative democracy our founders envisioned 250 years ago.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: But we must also recognize that, one year later,  many of the underlying causes of the tragedy of January 6th remain – including continued disinformation campaigns, hyperpartisanship, and emboldened extremists willing to circumvent our electoral system.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: We rightly celebrate the victory of democracy over violence last year.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Despite the siege of the Capitol, the insurrection, orchestrated by some at our government’s highest levels, failed at the end of the day, Congress completed its constitutional duties and two weeks later we witnessed a peaceful transition of power to a new administration.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: From escaping  the House Gallery as a violent crowd tried to break through the chamber doors to defiantly returning later that evening to fulfill our job and certify the count of electoral ballots, the day for me represented the steely resilience of our democratic institutions.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: January 6th is a day seared into my memory.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text:
No one man gets to decide when we give up on these causes. I will never give up on this work. And I pray that Senator Manchin can find a way to not give up here either. 

Even if today our differences may temporarily feel unbridgeable, we are a strong nation and will persevere.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: The Build Back Better Act will lift up our nation and directly address these challenges by lowering the cost of prescription drugs, building our clean energy economy and lifting children out of poverty. All while easing inflationary pressures and being 100% paid-for.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: We cannot let the vagaries of any one Senator, nor the intransigence of extremists, stand in the way of our meeting the challenges confronting our nation.  From a breaking health care system, to a rapidly warming climate, to our children’s future, we stand at the crossroads.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: I came to Congress nearly a decade ago to improve the lives of the people I represent. We cannot afford to chase dreams of castles built in the clouds. Nor can we afford to throw up our hands when things are hard.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: I was therefore pleasantly surprised to learn that she made the time to visit the Holocaust Memorial Museum (where I have the honor of serving as a trustee), and I appreciate that after her visit she understood the harm of her comparison and offered an apology.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: After all, Rep. Greene has a long history of unapologetically inflammatory and dangerous rhetoric.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: But when I heard Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene initial make her comparison of our nation’s Covid-response to the Holocaust, and then repeat it again and again, I never expected a retraction or an apology.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Sometimes we may stumble in our message. When we do, we should be given the chance to clarify exactly what we intended to say and promptly set the record straight.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: I believe that words matter and that they have consequences. Elected officials, and especially members of Congress, have a great responsibility to carefully measure our words and be as precise as possible when we communicate.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: I want you to know that we will never forget the sacrifices you and your loved ones have made to battle this pandemic, and that I will continue to fight for you in Congress, funding the programs necessary to keep you in the fight and accelerate our distribution of vaccines.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Consider this note my way, on behalf of the 700,000+ people I represent, of cheering out our window to you.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: As the months have passed, it can feel that America’s collective appreciation for the same work has waned, that the tedious nature of combatting a pandemic has dulled our vigor, or that we are suffering from “COVID fatigue.”

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: At the beginning of this pandemic, we all watched viral videos of people cheering out their windows to health care workers returning home from their long shifts.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: So while it may feel that there is no rest for the weary, I want you to know that you are very much appreciated.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Many of you are working long, grinding shifts. Many of you won’t be able to see loved ones this holiday season. These sacrifices must certainly carry unbearable weight after months of tireless work.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Sadly, we are seeing more cases, more illness, and more deaths.  I know you experience each of these cases personally, and I can only imagine the emotional and professional pressure laid upon you. I also know each of you are making enormous sacrifices at home as well.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: We know that we are calling on you to perform heroic acts, day in and day out.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: You all have been working tirelessly for more than 9 months. And while the rest of us enjoyed the beautiful summer, you have been preparing for the surge we now face. Please know we see and we appreciate all you have done and all that we are asking of you now.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: To the Drs, RNs, techs and others caring for patients; to the hospital admins, custodians, administrative assistants, and all who make that care possible; I want to convey to each of you my own, and our entire community’s, immense gratitude for your selfless work.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: So in that spirit, let me also extend a heartfelt thanks for your dedication and sacrifice as we battle this pandemic.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Though this year will be unlike any other, we must not lose sight of the deeper meaning of the holiday.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: I look forward to continuing to work with my colleagues in Congress to help promote the conditions for that lasting peace and security.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: As Bahrain’s Foreign Minister Abdullatif al Zayani put it, "Today's agreement is an important first step and it is now incumbent upon us to work urgently and actively to bring about the lasting peace and security our people deserve."

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: As Prime Minister Netanyahu today said, "those who bare the wounds of war cherish the blessings of peace." Those blessings will only be fully realized with hard work and continued United States engagement.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Just as we did then, we should mark this day with President Trump hosting Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and the foreign ministers of UAE and Bahrain as hopefully a harbinger of more good things to come.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: As well when President Clinton hosted Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin and King Hussein of Jordan in 1994.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: The significance of today’s steps for peace is not lost on those of us who have sought it across the decades. I vividly remember when President Carter hosted Prime Minister Menachem Begin and President Anwar Sadat to sign the first peace agreement with Egypt in 1979.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: I pray that these accords will open the door to a new era of peace between Israel and her neighbors, including progress to a negotiated two state solution to the Israeli/Palestinian conflict.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text:
Today, I was honored and humbled to personally witness the signing ceremony at the White House for the two historic peace agreements between the United Arab Emirates, Bahrain and Israel. 
https://t.co/ST7vsIq4YL

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: I also look forward to continuing to work with the Administration and my colleagues in Congress to promote future progress towards true and lasting peace, and bringing greater security to Israel, and all nations in the region.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Like with past agreements with Egypt and Jordan, the United States has always been a vital interlocutor, steadfast in our special alliance with Israel, including economic support and critical assurances of her qualitative military edge.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: I pray that this momentum might ultimately forge a path to an agreement between Israel and the Palestinians, ensuring a secure, Jewish, democratic Israel living side-by-side with a Palestinian state with peace, security, and prosperity for both peoples.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Such an achievement would have been impossible without years of diligent work from Israel, the UAE, Bahrain, the State Department, and Presidential administrations going back generations.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Today's historic agreements to normalize relations between Israel and Bahrain and the UAE represent further movement toward better relations throughout the region and better security for Israel and her neighbors.

tweet_text: We are left to ask how such violence could have been avoided in the first place.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: Since the beginning of the investigation, I have repeated that I will be guided by the facts and will follow them wherever they lead. Only by fully understanding what happened in 2016 will help us better defend against foreign efforts to influence future elections.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: It is important that Congress review the full, unredacted report and that Special Counsel Mueller publicly testify to share these findings with the American public.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: In particular, the Special Counsel report makes clear that the President sought repeatedly to undermine and interfere with the investigation, and in some instances was prevented from doing so only by his staff ignoring or refusing to carry out his instructions.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: The facts as laid out in the report stand in stark contrast to Attorney General Barr’s attempts to spin the conclusions through a pre-release summary and press conference.

name: Rep. Brad Schneider
tweet_text: I am pleased that the Special Counsel report is finally public and the American people can now read the findings for themselves on foreign interference in the 2016 election.
